âœ… Auto ban IP addresses by detecting failed logins from event viewer and/or log files
âœ… Supports monitoring for SSH on Linux, and RDP, OpenSSH, VNC, MySQL, SQL Server, Exchange, SmarterMail, MailEnable on Windows
âœ… Highly configurable thresholds for failed login counts and ban durations
âœ… Fast banning mechanism, with optional polling intervals for log files
âœ… Easy unbanning via an unban.txt file
âœ… Supports both IPv4 and IPv6
âœ… Precompiled binaries available for download, eliminating .NET SDK dependency on servers
âœ… One-click install script for Windows

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

IPBan is a free, open-source security software for Windows and Linux that automatically blocks IP addresses attempting to gain unauthorized access to servers. It monitors system logs and event viewers for failed login attempts and uses firewall rules to ban malicious IPs, protecting servers from hackers and botnets.
